title: Ticket #4760: Ignore additional files in config directory
description:
The current default list of files to ignore in the configuration directory is insufficient. At a minimum, cfengine backup files should be added to the list.

From Tom Downes on the HTCondor-LIGO mailing list:

I'd like you to consider changes to how you manage the /etc/condor/config.d directory. I suggest that you either explicitly exclude some common extensions that are produced as backups (.*~$ .*\.cfsaved$ .*\.dpkg-dist \*.rpmsave etc) or only poll for files with an explicit extension (like /etc/ld.so.conf.d).

Reasoning: cfengine produces cfsaved backup files all over the place unless you ask it not to. Because these backups occur lexically after their intended replacement, they overwrite the values that you were actually trying to change!

I have managed to find LOCAL_CONFIG_DIR_EXCLUDE_REGEXP and I think you should just expand it to include more default values.

^((\..*)|(.*~)|(#.*)|(.*\.rpmsave)|(.*\.rpmnew)|(.*\.dpkg-dist)|(.*cfsaved))$

I'm not sure the interior parens are necessary if this is an extended regular expression... but maybe you need them because of the parentheses everywhere rule in condor configurations.
remarks:
2015-Jan-16 13:21:03 by tim:
Code Review: Brian Lin looked over this configuration change. After some discussion it was approved. The only concern was the dpkg-old file (which are equivalent to the rpmsave files). However, a problem would only occur if we screwed up the packaging in a major way or some other package would be providing HTCondor configuration files. In the end, it made more sense to exclude backup files from RPMs and debs in the same way as from editors and cfengine.
